title: YAML Parser
description: Parse a subset of YAML (YAML Ain't Markup Language), a human-friendly data serialization format commonly used for configuration files and data exchange.

motivation.why: YAML is widely used for configuration in CI/CD pipelines, Kubernetes, Docker Compose, and static site generators. Its indentation-based structure makes it highly readable for humans.
useCases: CI/CD pipeline configuration (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI)
Static site generator front matter (Jekyll, Hugo)

inputFormat.description: YAML uses indentation to define structure. Key-value pairs use `key: value` syntax, lists use `- item` prefix, and nested structures are defined by increased indentation.

examples.description: Basic key-value pairs with scalar types

examples.input:
inline: [a, b, c]
object: { x: 1, y: 2 }

outputFormat.description: The parser returns a YamlValue enum that can be Null, Boolean, Integer, Float, String, Array, or Object, matching YAML's type system.

type.description: YamlValue enum with variants: Null, Boolean, Integer, Float, String, Array, Object
